headline: Show HN: Math Type for Python
description:
Hey all, I'm one of the co-founders of Luminal — a new Python workspace for scientists & engineers. It's still a work in progress (it's only been a few months!), but there's one feature that I think is cool that I'd like to share already: math type for Python.

Basically it renders complex equations like this one:

e = (1-(B1.rV1*2)/μ_S(2-(B1.rV1*2)/μ_S)math.cos(γ1)*2)*(1/2)

as math type (i.e. like LaTeX), directly in your code. This can help read or "debug" equations (plus it just looks pretty).

Try it for free at https://getluminal.com and let us know what you think!
